post.title: Meet Yanmo Omorogbe: COO/Co-founder of Bamboo
post.excerpt: Yanmo aims to simplify investment and make it accessible to Africans, enabling them to grow their personal wealth.
post.content:
Yanmo Omorogbe is the co-founder and chief operating officer at Bamboo. 

Yanmo, an alumna of Imperial College, London, started her career as a business development intern at Wecyclers Corporation in 2014. 

Before founding Bamboo, she was an investment Analyst at the African Infrastructure Investment Managers (AIIM). In 2019, she Co-founded Bamboo, an investment platform that gives Africans the tools to build wealth from ground up through real-time access to global markets. Bamboo allows individuals to become shareholders in technology companies like Google, Apple, Amazon, Twitter, Microsoft and Facebook.

Yanmo aims to simplify investment and make it accessible to Africans, enabling them to grow their personal wealth.

node.title: Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua has become the first black woman to hold a PhD in Cybernetics
node.excerpt: An award-winning Nigerian Professor, Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua, has emerged as the first black woman in the world to earn a doctorate (PhD) in Cybernetics, which is the scientific study of control and communication in animals and machines, concerned with understanding complex systems like learning, cognition, adaptation, emergence, communication, and efficiency. node.title: Tech Sales vs Business Development
node.excerpt: Tech sales and Business development are important for generating revenue for companies in the tech industry. While both of them play the same role of contributing to the company’s growth, they do it in a different way and timeframe.
